Posts.Content: Sighs with exasperation......3.5hrs sleep in 2 nights. Steroids wore off a few days ago now, just cant sleep,...last night was because i was whittling about our daughter..flew to Bangkok and was waiting her text to say all checked in at hotel, which she did 03.15hrs. Tonight though feel cream crackered cant stop my thoughts whirring around, mainly about pre assessment for surgery..type etc and thoughts/anxieties about that....if i could turn my thoughts off id be fine. Hubbys gone to spare room as im so restless, i'll settle for a cuppa (more peeing) and Stephen Fry audiobook. Sleep pattern is all over since chemo, havent napped during day either for weeks.  Deep breathing, dimmed lights...and relax......
Posts.Title: Sleepless Nights

Posts.Content: Had my surgery yesterday..WLE, SNB & Mammoplasty. All went well..had scans and wire insertion prior to theatre and then in and out in 2.5hrs..luckily work at the Trust had my surgery in so knowing ward staff well made the procedure much easier..psychologically.All in all not as bad as i was antcipating. I was however pee'd off post op tho..went to a Gynae ward overnight from Day Unit...had to request analgesics and at one point had 1.5hr wait for dose, also found my chart this am and saw they'd missed doses of Oxycodone last night and 6am that i was prescribed!..ggrr..luckily just about managed with PRN meds tho was in discomfort overnight. Fingers crossed for clear margins and nodes..find out results on 29th Oct. Home soon though and looking forward to recovering and then onto Radiotherapy...finishing just before Christmas...what a nice pressie thats gonna be.
Posts.Title: Getting there.

Posts.Content: Hi Mistymoley..my discharge also took hours!...told at 9.20am could go by Spr, at 1515 was chomping at the bit as still no discharge script or letter done....1545 i was given script for Paracetamol and Ibruprofen and letter....what?..i had those at home and id waited 6hrs for those!.Bearing in mind had had Tramadol during day id asked the SPR to include codeine incase needed ...so further delay waiting for that to be corrected and on taking to pharmacy he'd asked then for payment for it..i refused as said was part of my discharge meds..he then couldn't do as apparently wrong form, so hubby again returned to ward and complained, the ward sister then came with the Codeine and another letter (4th script) and gave me it and gave personal info to me whilst i was sat in a busy main entrance area surrounded by visitors...she was laughing at how long it had all taken...i however it was fair to say wanted to punch her lights out at that point! Farcical, incompetent and unprofessional from start to finish on that ward. I most certainly will be ringing BCN tomorrow as no post op instructions given to me either from ward staff...i however had sought these previously, but what if i hadnt been in the know? Total of 7.5hrs to discharge me, no wonder there are bed shortages, and am so disapointed that this occurred where i work. Also had had to have Flotrons on post op and overnight due to DVT risks but not given 10pm Fragmin as prescribed either..., but i do remember telling night nurse that i needed to have it...i was very tired and had then nodded off just after telling her. All in all not good, im not bashing the nhs...i do work in it and know how hard it can be but for the sake of pre planning discharges and simply following written prescriptions my experience should have been alot more comfortable.. Anyway, a bit sore and tired today but ALL the family have been round at points during the day, lots of goodies and flowers ...and then had lovely Sunday lunch made by my hubby, with our daughter her fella and my mum.. been spoilt rotten...so feeling the love once again.
Posts.Title: Getting there.

Posts.Content: 25       After 2 ops in 3 weeks for firstly WLE & mammoplasty which failed & then one for debridement and needing another lot of surgery in a fortnight.... "atleast your boobs will be small enough to wear those nice tops now"....you can just f¥*k right off. ......aagghh thats better.
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Sometimes yeah, and it does weigh me down, but i try not to dwell too long on how i now look... i know when im a little bit further down the line recovering from this i'll change again and be a liitle more recognisable. Ive put weight on, ive baby fluff all over my face as my hair grows back, my knees hurt and ive a wound that needs 2 more ops on it to make it look less gruesome..but im grateful that my treatment has been effective and im going forward slowly.
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Hi... Sorry to hear re your wound issues. My advice and sadly born through experience is contact you BCN & insist on a review and once seen ensure you have a point of contact and plan if things should deterioate over the Christmas period. Just incase you need to know when, how,whom to ring and where you can access help/advice because soon services will be reducing due to Festive period...the Surgical team can liase with District Nurses re treatment advice. I had wound issues and needed further review over last Christmas...luckily i went straight to appropriate person as i had made sure i knew who that was beforehand...otherwise this time of year weekend/bank holiday and out of hours provision can be a mare. As for antibiotics..hopefully A wound swab was done and they can then see exactly which med to give for treatment of the bugs found...in meantime it'll probably be a 'cover all' antibiotic to initially treat. Hope you are healed and comfortable soon and that things have settled by next weekend. Jo
Posts.Title: what is the best Antibiotic for wound infection after mastectomy....

Posts.Content: Agree G'nJ ...ive a feeling whatever she does from now on is gonna have to well judged and hopefully for her not misrepresented...wish her well but wont be reading any of her blog.
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: Hi guys...just having a moan, as pee'd off big styley. Finished Chemo 1/9/15 mammoplasty &SNB op on 16/10/15...but as have said before this failed leaving me with a necrotic wound. Now day 50 post 1st Op - 3 ops down, 4 debridements and waiting further surgery before Crimbo for hopefully close & grafting. Have Vac Pac on which is working but really painful at times but sticking with it, its also so heavy! Has anyone else had to have a graft to their wound...tbh im cacking myself as fear this will be more painful than the wound! Had to cancel crimbo plans as probably better to be at home than in the Lakes where we'd booked.  Really want an end to it now..can't sleep, fatigued, in pain, i think i smell, ongoing restricted lifestyle still - cancelled umpteen planned events/meet ups. Worried re delay to Radiotherapy too...realistically this is gonna be end of Jan/Feb...how will that affect things? Also not taking Tamoxifen cos of recurring surgeries. Pee'd off, tired, losing my mojo. Rant over. Oh and now my VacPac is beeping..not working...sick of this sh!#.District nurses duly called.
Posts.Title: Feels Neverending....

Posts.Content: Thanks for your kind words gals.  Unfortunately vino has been off the menu...last time i had a drink it was a half a shandy- when in Docetaxel in Sept cos thats all i could stomach taste wise...even had to add lemonade to that as was too strong...reet shandypants i am now. No worries re cooking..goin to my Bro's now. Just need to ride this through i guess, its just hard at times..been goin to Ossie everyday for 2 weeks for review and now its thankfully just Mon & Thurs - 46 mile round trip. Im just tired. If DN puts temporary dressing on today im gonna get the Decs up whilst im unemcumbered!! ..always a bright side.
Posts.Title: Feels Neverending....

Posts.Content: Enjoy your beach day Joellen....love being at the coast, calms my soul. Im sure i'll be ok...just my track record with chemo & surgery threw a few hurdles at me...hopefully 3rd Treatment type lucky!! x
Posts.Title: 1st Radiotherapy session tomorrow...really scared

Posts.Content: Hi all... Had first session on Friday...asked re what moisturisers to use but my unit only advises Aqueous cream.. axel grease! Got Aveeno to use if need also...sshh! Was told skin will be seen by nurse/my onco atleast weekly and had last minute review before session too...double check all ok to carry on as planned. But sore on scar and wound area after 1/15 but a little "exposing" to fresh air and creaming and was relieved...can see the cool June evening breeze will be of benefit these next few weeks!!...good job were 'privately' situated. Have a good weekend.xx
Posts.Title: 1st Radiotherapy session tomorrow...really scared

Posts.Content: So after weeks of "am i" or "arent i" having it, and changing my mind and reasoning everyday, tomorrow is my first session of Radiotherapy.  Least i can decompress over the weekend as i know i'm gonna be on the ceiling with anxiety. Not about the process just the effects. But as i've said i never want to host this $#!t again so gonna do all i can to try prevent any recurrence. Any last min tips?? 14 long months to get here since diagnosis, 8mths of post op recovery, but i'm so near to the end now. My fear cannot get in the way of whats important and necessary, so im striding through it and getting on with it. I've dealt with all its chucked at me so far..im somewhat of a reluctant wound specialist now, & am sure the healing will be worse than the actual process but .... lets' do it, ...then its all finished. The fire within is far greater than the fire without!!! Jo.x
Posts.Title: 1st Radiotherapy session tomorrow...really scared

Posts.Content: Hi bluesy...thats exactly what it is...frustration mixed with fatigue. Its worse when youre a stubborn ole sod like me, i need to learn to give in sometimes and not want to be superwoman all the time. Hope youre doing well now. DN's been...vacpac working again...Decs can stay in the loft for now.x
Posts.Title: Feels Neverending....

Posts.Content: Interesting discussion guys....as im having RT after wounds heal, im looking into skin products which will give me most protection on my scars....really worried re RT burns causing it to breakdown.
Posts.Title: R1 and R2 treatments for skin damage caused by radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I had been on Tamoxifen 20mg a day for 18months,Teva brand, and had real problems with nightly leg cramps, sweats & flushes and had awful pain in left hip and thigh. Bloods showed I was post menopausal so switched to Anastrazole..again Teva brand. Thankfully my leg cramps have virtually stopped, my left hip and leg pain whilst still there isn't as severe, though my rampant flushes continue.  Only real problem I've noted is with the "runs" (sorry), its getting right on my wick!; though I've only been on AI's for 3 months so will consider switching when have my GP review in a few weeks. Oh the joys...
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi guys... basically agree with all Julia advises....but since taking D3, K2, Vit E, Vit C and Iron I feel this has made a massive difference to my wound healing and definitely my mood...Think D3 is the main component for this. I have also been eating a few nuts - almonds , daily for Selenium. I do try follow a more healthier diet overall and have greatly reduced alcohol, fat, red meat and refined sugar intake...though I do have a treat now & then too.
Posts.Title: Vitamin supplements & diet advice ?

Posts.Content: Hi Pinkshoe..sorry to read of you're problems with your wound love. Unfortunately it happens and tho no solice to us going through post op difficulties just be assured you're in the best hands. Ive had necrosis of my wound following mammoplasty on 16th Oct...ive had differing dressings and a VacPac ..which sounds like the equipment you have at the mo...works on negative pressure(sucking) onto your wound??.. this worked well for me and vastly improved healthy tissue growth. Hope it does same for you. Eat well..high protein diet, take Vit C and rest. Ensure youre supported by your BCN...contact them as it really is a psychological toll youre dealing with.  I had further surgery yesterday - op 4 -after having vacpac off to close the wound, fingers crossed this works.. unfortunately i reacted to all my dressing so my skin aint in great condition but we can but see and hope it doesnt break down again. Sending a gentle hug your way, keep yer chin up...it will improve but just takes time..its not easy but we are made of strong stuff. I had preadjuvant chemo and now awt radiotherapy too, HER&ER positive grade/stage2 invasive Ca...lymph nodes negative. The rads will be to belt+brace treatment to mop up any cancer cells but try not to worry re the delay too much. "It always seems impossible until its done"..xx
Posts.Title: Post-surgery waiting for radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hey JJ. It sounds idylic...i love the Pelopenese. Definitely protect the scar/wound from the sun, ... depends what your wounds like now... My wound eventually responded to just plain old Mepilex Transfer.- silicone type dressing....after id tried every option going. Got it to superficial granulation stage where i could then leave it dry/scab over and left it 'undressed' for a couple of weeks. Overgranulation was a problem with some dressings too. Best thing i did was just not dress it at all & kept it dry.  Finally healed 30th July...288 days/41weeks/9months post op...yep i definitely counted. Happy sailing and hope you heal soon...though guess your mind and soul already has. Jo.
Posts.Title: Hi all update JJsailor

Posts.Content: Hi...i really worried about my hair regrowth but needn't have...had last chemo in Sept 15 but had a very sparse fluff at time of my last Docetaxel...by October it was a grey/thin covering all over...actually went to a wedding without a scarf mid October in Italy. By Christmas had a cool curly grey Judy Dench style growth...my hair was always mousey brown, wispy and straight prior to chemo so loved my new look. Now its just unruly...full stop!!....thick, curly, black/grey....keep it short but always did, still liking it this way too. x
Posts.Title: Question about hair growth

Posts.Content: Happy Easter to all....hope everyone has a lovely peaceful weekend.
Posts.Title: Easter hugs

Posts.Content: Morning Fiddlesticks.. Like you, Mildred and Jintyp im waiting results this week after surgery and can completely relate. Had pre adjuvant chemo so am desperately hoping all is goid and i can move onto radiotherapy next and avoid another op. Why is 3am such a bogey time when all our little monsters come out from under the bed? Though saying that since diagnosed my sleep pattern is shattered and as most have mentioned i find myself reading, browsing t'internet or sipping tea till about 430 then i dose off again.  I love walking at the mo and have found the most comfy sports bra post op to wear so i can still have a jaunt around the lovely local countryside here. A few times while listening to music on these walks ive crumbled and shed gallons of tears....but always feel better when im home. Its easier to let go of all the baggage in my head when im on my own as also feel like my family expect me to feel better now ive had my op.Said to my fab hubby yesterday..'i dont want you to understand how i feel..just realise i am feeling this way sometimes' Hold on girls, time will pass by and soon we'll know what we have coming up next to help us overcome this s#!t disease. Wishing you all well and sending hugs to all. Jo.
Posts.Title: Not coping/coping with the wait for results.

Posts.Content: Morning All, Had my surgery on 16th Oct for Grade 2, Stage 2 IDC HER+ & ER +, ..had Therapeutic Mammoplasty to left breast  and SNB after Chemo for 18 weeks.I get my results on Thursday and also have my dressings removed for first time then also. Luckily the dressings haven't been an issue and discomfort to wounds bearable. Main issue burning sensation to axilla/inner arm from SNB surgery..but guess will resolve over time. Emotionally i've been all over the place post op, maybe due to fact i've felt relatively well and 'had time' to think about things whilst at home alot.... Im not sleeping well...few hours a night and waking early constantly over thinking things and worrying about my forth coming Appt. Can any one tell me how these things go..? I know i'll have wounds assessed ...im expecting alot of stitches out. The wound is different to what i expected and tbh more breast tissue has been removed than i thought too, about half size comparatively now...obviously im worried as to why now? .. im driving myself nuts!! Being a larger breasted gal im not bothered about new size and will ask about surgery to right side to 'even' things up in the future. What info is usually given to you from these post op appts...Node results, tissue results - ? re staging if appropriate etc, which im the most concerned about, ....i honestly think i'm more anxious now than at any other stage from my diagnosis thru chemo and surgery.  Any advice or experiences would be really helpful,...in training my mind to stop doing somersaults and just flipping calm down. Jo
Posts.Title: Feeling anxious....what can i expect?

Posts.Content: Heres hoping for dissolvable stitches!!...tbh i didnt ask what they used to close the wound and given ive had dressings covering all since...ive no idea. Theres been only very slight leakage and that was in first few days do hopefully all will come away neatly and easily. Thanks ladies for that reassurance and Bluesy i am literally focussing on one day after the next and am trying to stay positive...going out,seeing friends, Crimbo shopping, walks etc etc Im not too worried re wound, scars etc....Its more the outcome of results for the SNB etc as the thought of another op makes me quiver with dread. It seems all i've felt for 6 months is 'uncomfortable' and just want a few weeks break from that before radiotherapy starts. i'm also due to start Tamoxifen and restart my Herceptin next week (hopefully after it was suspended), when see my Onco Dr. I know i'm not the only one, i know i need to sort my head out and after all treatment is complete it will absolutely be worth it. Im just p!$$ed off, feel useless and sick of hearing myself moan....im getting on my own nerves.
Posts.Title: Feeling anxious....what can i expect?

Posts.Content: Bon Voyages JJ... Hope you have many adventures and beautiful sunsets to enjoy...may the wind always fill your sails.xx
Posts.Title: Nearly there

Posts.Content: Evening all..had onco review today pre FEC2 on Tuesday....having Fe, B12,Folate and thyroid function checked as still have pins & needles in feet and hands, plus had some other neuro signs....discomfort swallowing and altered sensation in mouth to hot & cold for first 8-9 days post FEC 1....not known SE of FEC apparently...hope its somat simple like B12 defeciency as not looking forward to same with next lot of chemo....   Plus side tumour has shrunk a little after FEC1 & we're going away in Northumberland for weekend, hairs dropping out quickly but hope lasts till after weekend as at a Spa..may need to take daughters swim cap with me!!   Suns been shining, beautiful here in Yorkshire, lovely meal out with daughter & boyfriend tonight..gonna enjoy this weekend, ... hope everyone else is enjoying the sun too.xxJo
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi all,  im day 4 post FEC2..and unlike last time the nausea has been the problem, worse on first evening...yuck,....dislike ondansetron as gave me awful indigestion so taking metoclopramide as and when, finished steroids but not as manic this time on reduced dosage. .... fatigued for past few days and slept alot and fuzzy head has hit big time today & cotton mouth..defo spicy food for next few days if tummy tolerates. One thing is pins and needles havent been a problem so far...yay, just looking forward to getting to day 8/9 when normality hopefully starts to resume. Did mow lawn yesterday tho...daubed in factor 30 but still got more freckles on my face today...its been persisting it down here in Yorks this am, so trip to shops for birthday card shopping...daughters 19th next week, then treated to KrispyKreme doughnut by hubby...during nausea free slot. Hope next few days bring everyone brighter times, Jo,x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi all, Janet i get tenderness in my arms from having the FEC via a cannula...probable chemical phlebitis..irritation from the meds on the lining of the veins..advised to use topical Ibuprofen gel by onco nurse to ease it. .. it does drive me mad at times though. I can relate to feeling down re hair/ body image...mine nearly all came out ptobable just 2.5 weeks after 1st chemo, again ive always had short hair too, as couldnt be bothered coiffeuring at 5.30 in the morning before startting my shifts...had some wispy bits after main malting session which seemed to have a growth spurt of their own...finally shaved my head and feel so much better for doing so....got sick of seeing myself in the mriror and to be honest it actually made me look worse than i felt..so its gone. Welldone Hev on completion of youre chemo..enjoy youre time now until the next lot of youre treatment. Quiet week, struggling with nausea and fatigue mostly but each day a little better...10 days post 2nd FEC. Its our daughters 19th today, so lovely day with her..out for lunch & cinema and have meal out planned tomorow with family...having a curry....I do love them.  Take care all, Jo,x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks Amanda...will try that. Lost most of it this weekend when away with hubby...so on plus side had time to try differing scarf designs and not stress as surrounded by strangers. x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Ceskypesky..big hug for you,x hope everyone else who's had treatment feels reasonable at the moment, i found first few days were ok, it was days 4 to 8 that hit me, just had 2nd FEC this afty..juicy veins didnt let me down..bonus. All bloods ok,so onco & nurses a bit nonplussed with pins + needles in hands and feet..we'll just have to monitor and see...but getting a bit nervous for Docetaxel already. Sounds like most of you are onto the T part and Herceptin part of treatment now and be interesting to hear on you all get on...hopefully the discomfort won't be too bad and no one gets 'hit by the bus'.  Have heard differing outcomes and seen folk with PICC lines..must say im not that keen on any invasive device...so sorry youve had problems Birty..hopefully things will settle soon and youre on the righf treatment for the thrombosis......also praying my veins stand up to the battering theyre gonna get. wishing all a restful evening and good nights sleep. JO,x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Evening guys, Kazza  i had my period this week..due FEC2 on Tuesday....had a really uncomfortable time & cramps, ..heavy period...not usual for me but thank goodness its settled now.  Prepping for tuesday now - getting hydrated, bloods tomoz included a few extras to see why still pins and needles in my feet and hands, really not looking forward to this next lot of FEC...trying not to freak out too much and feeling a bit fed up today....mainly because my hair has nearly all fallen out over past 48 hrs. My scalps really tender and uncomfortable...just wish would all come out now.  Can anyone revommend anything i can use to soothe my tender scalp at all ( skins not broken and no obvious sores noted)....its driving me nuts & getting me down. jo,x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Lemon cheesecakeeeeeee!!!!..all the way...
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Judy and all.. I'm in the position of having had my Husband become a 'Brave Shaver' last summer whilst i was recieving chemo.  He announced his plan and then began organising a BBQ event which we held at our home, inviting all our family and friends...he actually raised ££££s, to his credit....but i hated every second of it, so much it made me feel sick to my stomach watching it. He became more animated and excited as the event neared...putting the countdown on Social Media, and telling everyone how "scared" he was becoming at becoming bald. He had his head shaved yes...but as you say it didn't strip him in any of the ways the effects of chemo did to me. I didn't say anything as he truly had all the best intentions and it gave him something to focus on through some very tough times for both of us. I cried when he'd done it...im not sure if that was purely at his attempts to try empathise with how i felt -(big fail) - and he has a good heart, or relief it was all finished. What made me very angry though was his mum crying as she watched him...saying "what have you done to yourself, you look awful"...hhmm. Would i encourage others to do the same fundraiser as they support their loved one going through treatment...no definitely not, it's too hard to process at the time and i remember having to really fight to quell my anger and upset towards him. I thought him to be a complete insensitive arse. I guess its difficult to think of novel ways to fundraise and Macmillan do a fantastic job of it...but its not appropriate to all. Jo
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: OK by me...I've already put a post on my FB thread and given my views.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Here's part of this poignant poem by Nick Robinson, BBC journalist, it sums up for me, how people who have a cancer diagnosis and other's terminology may cause upset to those under going treatments.  It is mainly the phrase used rather than the act itself that causes myself angst...as mentioned in my post near beginning of this thread after my husband took part in this fundraiser. Very personal experience. I do admire any fundraisers but as said before, not all the methods they and organisations use. It is that time of year again...I have deliberately tried to ignore social media posts by friends re: their efforts for this campaign, because even after a few years it literally makes my stomach lurch...irrational maybe but still it has that effect. "You ‘fought’ they said. You’ve been so ‘brave’ they said  Yet you know, I know, anyone who has faced it knows differently  Cancer is not a battle.  There is no choice whether to fight let alone whether to win or lose.  No amount of courage no measure of cowardice can decide the outcome....."
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn.   For me you nailed it with some kind of "hero or martyr"...thats exactly what so annoyed and upset me when my husband took part in it. I too on the whole embraced my baldness and didn't wear a wig and only put hat on for comfort at times..it was hot and sticky during summer and tolerating anything on my head was impossible with the chemo flushes & sweats. It was just the "ooooh im so scared" aspect and it boiled my ****. Really talk to and TRULY listen to folk under going these treatments...then and only then can you understand what Brave really is. (I may have some unresolved resentment issues....hahaha.) Jo
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I've continued taking with a few flights less than 4 hours and just wore flight socks, moved often and drank plenty water during flight. My GP did a bit of research for me when i asked if should stop Tamoxifen 2 weeks prior to Caribbean flight of 9 hours...her findings were inconclusive. Some advice said stop, others that the effects of the drug continue for 4-6 weeks so pointless stopping. She said choice was mine...so i wore my flight socks and stopped anyway...2 weeks break is ok. Enjoy your hols.
Posts.Title: Flying while on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Kasash,....great news. i had surgery on 16th oct - SNB plus 3 nodes removed and WLE/ Mammoplasty - and got great results today. I found wearing 'Softies' from Asda ideal for first few days then sports bras from M&S...non wired, as gave great support. I bought cup size up from my normal due to anticipated swelling post op and bra extenders as mentioned are great idea.Also found built in support vest tops really comfy.. again from good ole M&S. Basically something soft cupped, non wired and easy to get on and off, front opening t-shirts/pjs /vest tops too. I can't comment on drain as didnt have one.Take pain relief regularly and exercises really do help. Hope you get on ok, good luck,x
Posts.Title: what to wear

Posts.Content: Thanks Jackie, that does reassure me, and will Defo try those techniques. Hopefully after tomorrow will have clearer view of things.xx
Posts.Title: Meet oncologist tomorrow re treatment plan

Posts.Content: Evening all, hope everyone has had a good day today. I meet my oncologist tomorrow re the neo adjuvant chemo plan for my stage 2 ICD, I've been racking my brains re questions to ask and am slightly freaking out now. The ones I've thought of so far are :- regime timings, what types and effects of them, tests along the way, precautions, iv access routes, emergency contacts, ...but starting to hit a blank. If anyone has any suggestions or advice re any other questions that may be helpful from their chemo journey I'd really appreciate it. I've decided not to do the cold cap as my hair is really short anyway and the potential hair loss isnt really bothering me.....at present. Been a long week, hopefully I'll sleep tonight, it's becoming a startling reality now. Thanks all.xx Jo.
Posts.Title: Meet oncologist tomorrow re treatment plan

Posts.Content: I can totally relate. Found that if sudocrem didnt work then Proshield foam wash from GP was fantastic and prevented recurrence. x
Posts.Title: labia / lady parts / why does it sting when I pee ? undocumented chemo...

Posts.Content: Hi Nina, i too am sorry to hear your news, ...i had a clip inserted prior to starting chemo on Tuesday, as Hevbojangles said its done under local and only takes short time...i didnt have any problems during or after.   take care, Jo,x
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: HI YorkA, What can i say different to the above replies, as all very sound advice. I was diagnosed April 2015...IDC stage 2 and DCIS, ER+, HER+...had neo adjuvant chemo..(pre surgery), then surgery and now awaiting radiotherapy. Thankfully had good response to chemo with clear nodes and complete response on my results following my surgery.  Im 48, have a 19yr old st Uni and initially on diagnosis my immediate and natural response was like every one elses...youre mind does somersaults as well as your stomach and for the first few weeks it is really hard. But be assured you will be surrounded by a fantastic team of professional helping you, this board and its members will give you invaluable support when you need it - its picked me up countless times, and you and youre family will find your way through this...we are all stronger than we initially thought we ever could be. Take youre time to adjust, be kind to yourself, take one stage at a time and take every opportunity you have to talk to your friends, family and anyone who lends you a shoulder to lean on and time to talk...be honest about how you feel with those you feel you can be to. Wishing you luck.  Btw..are you from where your name suggests?...if so hope youre not affected too badly by the current situation there. X
Posts.Title: reigning in the fear

Posts.Content: Thanks Maggie....it sure is a relief, tentatively hopeful that its gonna continue, its still a way off but atleast theres good signs now.
Posts.Title: Efficacy of Herceptin

Posts.Content: So had interesting conversation with my  Onco Consultant today. Apparently now looking at being able to give Herceptin over a 2 year period and still maintain its efficacy against recurrence.  Its stopped till complete wound healing has occurred for me but he did say i will then ? resume it...had 7 doses and complete upto thd 18 initially prescribed. This will definitely take me beyond a year of initially commencing it in July. Hes reviewing in 2 months. Im now not having Radiotherapy.....risk of it causing wound breakdown is too much, and apparently local recurrence risk is "piffling" for me. Im relieved tbh.... so that effectively means apart from ?? resuming Herceptin and Tamoxifen i've completed treatments!!   Im not counting wound dressings of course....im looking at the positives. Big glass of vino and a humungous bar of chocolate to myself to celebrate tonight ....him indoors can get his own!! Cheers all.x
Posts.Title: Efficacy of Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi all.... Had my Herceptin stopped after 7 doses since end of July for Stage 2 Her & ER + IDC and DCIS, clear margins and neg nodes. Stopped due to my wound issues, and also stopped Tamoxifen now but probably restart that once certain no further surgery needed. Question is how effective have those 7 doses been for me?....as its very unlikely i'll restart it as deemed to be main reason for wound not healing and hypersensitivity, which still have a couple of months yet before fully does so, tho thankfully atlast (!!after alot of trial and prayers with dressings) that has started to occur now Herceptin levels reduced in my system. I had read that it stays systemically for upto 7 months. Is there an alternative to Herceptin? I see my onco on Thursday and want to be armed with questions, i dont want to now have the fear of recurrence/under treatment cause me sleepless nights....ive had enough of those. Thanks Jo.
Posts.Title: Efficacy of Herceptin

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply and info...has given me some food for thought. Unfortunately seems i'm one of the small % who are hypersensitive to it....and effects on healing have been awful. Guess other drugs of same 'family' may have same effects but i can ask. I too read the trial re 6 months rather than a years course....have to believe 7 doses are better than none. Am now alternate day dressing..yay!!..may not seem it but its fab to say that...onwards & upwards.  (Hopefully). Jo.x
Posts.Title: Efficacy of Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi all, can see the light at the end of the tunnel now. Finally on day 13 feeling a little more like normal after T1...second lot on Tuesday (5th cycle) after 1st Herceptin on Monday that is. Few things planned over next  days and finally its start of footy season on Saturday so a trip to Stevenage(!) is planned....to watch Notts County...i know, somebody has to. Then family curry night ...all round for good ole nosh up and few Cobras.  Got my op date of 12th October today tho need to meet with my Surgeon on 29th Sept to discuss options first...hopefully WLE & SNB. Rads after then all done by mid December....except Herceptin and then Tamoxifen. Feeling a bit more determined and positive now...was down earlier this week....but that chink of sunshine has made a difference.  Jo,x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Morning all, Day 11 post T2....and feel goood! Took me 2 weeks to get over first lot, actually went to beer garden last night with my shandypants on!...was lovely to feel normal, which i havent done for 5 weeks. Footy today in Nottingham, no doubt County will bring my feel good factor back to earth with a bump/loss, but hey, the suns shining and the day is to be grabbed...off for a walk by the river before the match....beats my previous prematch ritual of pie & pint! Hope all tnose having a tough time after their chemo or had it this week have a better day, ... i remember starting my chemo journey thinking it seemed soooo long till its over and doubting i could do it, now only 1 more to go and after my 3rd lot its seems to have flown. Hang on ladies, it will get better.  Jo,x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Mistymoley, will ring on Monday and contact my union then too....the letter is constructed/written in a non aggressive 'voluntary' basis spiel but it has made me FEEL under threat and pressure and is addressed directly to me, not a generic employee letter. For warned is for armed...time to start copying and witnessing any communications now too i think....i may be being completely over reacting but i sense probably not completely. Jo,x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, Bloods all done nice and early today, not easy after charity BBQ yesterday and loads staying over...hubby did Brave the Shave...raised in total £883.47, and then £313 for CRUK too, so not bad all in all. Absolutely cream crackered today. Not heard anything otherwise so its go go go for my last chemo tomorrow. For all of you just starting, its seems like that was me only few weeks ago, have faith that it goes quicker than you think it will, ...ive had a rough ride at times but it is do-able.....keep strong, you will get there.  Still having Herceptin,Tamoxifen and awaiting surgery in October but soo glad this part will be finished after 1pm tomorrow. xx Jo
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Morning all, Im starting yo see the chink of light at the end...5th cycle, 2nd Tax on Tuesday.....i too had awful bone pains with that plus the filgastrim....mainly pelvic,ribs and shins. Took Ibuprofen and Paracetomol as GnJ describe which eventually settled it with codeine on standby. It kicked in day 4/5 and lasted for few days. It was the fog/dizzyness and breathlessness that was my main problem, all settling after 12 days, but it did lift. Im dreading the next lot on Tuesday. Also got my first Herceptin tomorrow....anyone had experience of this...just wondering what i may expect??. Have to be in onco unit for atleast 4hrs for monitorring...got my audio books and bits n pieces organised, im not good at sitting in one place for too long. Anyway once this lot is in....im then on my last lot at the beginning of September....cannot bleddy wait. Atleast saw our team win yesterday..Notts Co...looking forward to watching the next few games..may even try get there on Tuesday night and Friday....as long as we win it'll be worth it. Goodluck to all having treatment in this next week, xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Good luck tomorrow for youre last one Chrissie, and all having treatment tomorrow/next few days, also hope those who've had problems are also on the mend too, its not easy but before you know you'll be over half way then its the home straight in site. Ive got my 5th tomorrow..2nd Tax, and feel oddly slightly excited...is that weird?..its because after that then its only 1 more cycle to go!. Had 1st Herceptin today...was fine, so far so good. Also consultant reviewed my Tax dose due to side effects id had esp pain, dizzyness and breathlessness...he said they were Stage 2 Side effects..??? anuone know what this means?....so reduced the dose of Tax and stopped the GCSF injs as said with new lower dose that i don't need them. Glad on one hand as may be easier this time round but a little worried that may be more risk of 'under treatment' as im having Neo adjuvant chemo. Anyway, roll on tomorrow then its just 21 days till last lot. x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Has anyone had pain in nail cuticles with Tax??..have had 2 doses of it now...worried its a sign of the nail bed being affected, feels a bit like nerve pain tbh..lasts only for few a seconds at a time. What do you recommend to  keep nails healthy...im using coconut oil at the moment and tho slightly dry theyre not looking too bad. Thamks, Jo.
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Well just got mail from my employer today...an NHS Trust, service for 28 years in total in NHS ... not all at this Trust, and offering me MARS...mutually agreeable resignation scheme.... Can honestly say its thrown me a bit...off since May...not finished chemo yet and awaiting op then rads and was then aiming to try get back to some sense of normality, but looks like the indirect pressure from my employer has begun. I know its a voluntary thing and probably triggered by a pathway & can be ignored but am really pee'd off now....got enough to think about at the mo, plus its come out of the blue...with no contact or discussions with my line managers or HR other than previously sending a sick note in for 3 months. Seriously going to look into union support and try to obtain as much info re my employment rights as i can .... trying to calm down but really upset at how insensitive this is. Jo
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Smoothie, again like Weeble i had periods throughout my FEC x 2..heavier than usual too but they stopped before 3rd FEC, none since, and am havin last Tax on 2nd Sept. The downside is flash mob flushes and sweats though ...whether due to chemo or menopausal symptoms im not sure. Good luck tomorrow, i always get a little down day before my chemo, be kind to yourself.x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Good on you JJ...all that natural Vit D will work wonders for your healing, and being back on the waves will be good for the soul.  x
Posts.Title: I've done it - booked flight

Posts.Content: Hi all, had oncology review today..all set for final chemo on Tuesday! Excellent response shown on MRI so far so hoping surgery will be WLE & SNB...was borderline for mastectomy as Invasive DCiS stage 2 ..5cmx4cm. Having further MRI in a few weeks before surgical review.  Having a few days away In Cartmel at the mo...Lake District, what a lovely village., husbands homed in on the local microbrewery which is also next to a cheese shop...heaven for him but torture for me seeing all those lovely blue  & goats cheeses. Cart load bought by him..im so jealous. Few shandies tonight and then upto Keswick tomorrow. Having a Brave the Shave Big Bald charity BBQ on Sunday...40+ coming to that, ... got loads of helpers sorted though so shouldnt be bad, im gonna kick back and have a Hairy Daquiri or 2 whilst he does the cooking before getting shawn.... though strictly oven cooked only for me. Have a good long weekend everyone.x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hey Pinkshoe....sorry its continuing for you like this. Have they checked for allergies.- to sutures etc, immuno status, rule out diabetes etc...cant remember if youve had chemo first as that can cause autoimmune problems, Herceptin if youre on it can delay healing also...ive had mine stopped now cos of healing issues...stil awt radiotherapy too once sorted...14 weeks and counting. Keep your chin up i know its bleddy hard but you will heal, it just takes time. Ensure your team is doing all it can for you to seek answers re delayed healing...sometimes they cant see outside their own specialities...if need referals ask for them ie Tissue Visbility, dermatology etc. Sounds like youre doing all the right things, don't give yourself a hard time, hugs sent your way.x
Posts.Title: Problems with wound healing after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi...i literally had mine stopped on Weds after 2 weeks in place. Made a massive difference to my wound...healthy granulation and would have stuck with it had i not reacted to the dressings as severely as i did. Mine was set at continous level...it did beep if sensor was occluded in drainage bit..wasnt full...it was just covering sensor so after repositioning it was fine. They can develop leaks and you should have contact numbers for District Nurses or hospital contact for iver weekend....if in doubt give them a ring. Im now 2 days post op wound closure...hoping continues to heal without probs so can go on to Rads. Take care.x
Posts.Title: Vac Pac

Posts.Content: Ah what a shame..I live in York but will be in Germany at a Stones gig. Another time perhaps. Enjoy beautiful York everyone.
Posts.Title: YORK MEET-UP 9TH SEPTEMBER 2017

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply hoggie...am guessing pico is a negative pressure dressing and device...unfortunately i'd had a vacpac...similar device for cavity wound 9x6x4cm..but couldn't tolerate it due to adhesive allergies from the film used to seal the dressing/device. Subsequently had wound operated on and attempts at closing failed x 3 to that area, now packed daily as you have had and it is slowly granulating. Tbh i'm confused re the clinical need for the graft suggested...as wound is healing. Ive nearly 99% decided against it if its for cosmetic reasons only...i can live with the scars. Best wishes hoggie. Jo
Posts.Title: Skin Grafts...need advice/info

Posts.Content: Hi all,  Saw my Oncoplastic yesterday who suggested i'm going to need a Split Skin Graft to one of the wounds on my breast..wound just near middle of my chest as its not fully healed and very friable.  She's also going to try close the other wound again -3rd attempt...but test for suture allergies first in 2 weeks time...it completely broke down and reopened in 3 days last time. Has anyone else had to have any Skin Grafting done?? Whats' it entail, do they use suturing to secure it,how long were you in for etc etc. Couldn't sleep last night as i'm so very nervous re more surgery - will be my 7th op, and secondly as i'm allergic to adhesive dressings, i'm really worried how they'll stabilise it enough for the graft to be able 'to take' and keep it covered with a dressing. I'm still using elasticated 'inco' pants to hold current dressings on and at times they 'slip'. To be honest the thought of anymore potential failed procedures or complications has made me cry - alot, but trying to get it to heal naturally isn't happening...my choices are limitted and all i want is this to be over, i'm so tired of it. So any info, advice will be greatly appreciated. This disease is a ba$#a€d but the treatment for it has been equally as terrible for me. Thanks. Jo.
Posts.Title: Skin Grafts...need advice/info

Posts.Content: Hi, i had a few hurdles with my insurance company, stage 2 invasive dcis....one paid within a week, the other was several months of form filling, phone calls and chasing up. Have had experience with CI before with my hubby...he has MS..one paid straight away therefore setting a precedence for the other company but still had to go through Insurance Ombudsman eventually. It took 18 months and was ALL back dated and tax refunded so worth the battle agaihst the company involved. Keep at them, dont let them wear you down.
Posts.Title: critical illness insurance

Posts.Content: My hubby works in Brussels every other week..lucky him, beer and chocs on tap! My faves are flavoured macaroons...heaven! mmm, feel better just thinking about them.haha. must put a repeat prescription in.xx
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: Eyup everyone, So coming up 2 yrs from diagnosis.. and 6 months post treatment completion.  Life is good, feel healthy,happy & back at work, doing all my usual pre treatment sports/hobbies..near enough 'normal' except intermittent chest lymph oedema...which is manageable at the mo. I was wondering what advice/guidelines have been given to folk re: taking Tamoxifen and long flights. We're going to the Caribbean in 3 weeks - 8.5hr flight, and so i rang my GP today as concerned re:thrombotic effects of Tamoxifen coupled with period of immobility.  I'm going to wear "flight socks" and ensure move every hour, drink plenty water etc but asked if should stop Tamoxifen 1-2 weeks prior to flying. I was told by Onco-plastic Surgeon to stop it 2 wks before surgeries but didnt ask re flights. GP was unsure, she did try research it but found conflicting info from different health trust/BNF etc. She did say "it was probably sensible" to stop for short period but was sorry couldn't give definitive advice. Anyone any wiser? Cheers for any info you may have. Jo.x
Posts.Title: Long Flights & Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Indeed Kazash Docetaxel is like being walloped by a big cricket bat. Aches,pains,fatigue like ive never felt before, breathless, tummy upsets,cack mouth...i could go on. I had my dose refuced by 25% after 1st dose due to side effects but it still knocked me for six... . Take it easy, dont try push yourself, you need to rest and reserve your energy for the things you love to do....housework can wait is my mantra. I was quite well with FEC and managed to do near normal activities...not with this! Ask your GP for something to settle your tummy...steroids can also cause gastric problems so may need an antacid or PPI (protects your tum) or similar...dont suffer if can get it sorted. Try bland, low fat foods, cut out caffeine as can irritate stomach also...milk/yoghurt based smoothies may help if not eating much at present. It will settle and just keep in mind that its doing its job on the cancer cells...take care. jo
Posts.Title: Docytexal

Posts.Content: When i was initially diagnosed..a further 3 of my work colleagues were also given their news within a fortnight of each other!!...we developed a mini self help group and find we can chat a have a laugh freely with each other...as well as seeing each other through some tough times over the past year. Similar diagnosis but varying experiences of the same treatments and nhs organisation too. Another close friend also has been here and its been such a help having her guide and support me through this year...as i had with her, i knew slightly what to expect treatments wise. Also out of 10 family members...4 of us have had cancers this past 2 years....prevalescence is definitely increasing...or is that screening and diagnostics are vastly improved... One things for sure treaments and clinical advancements are definitely improved too...some talk of 'chronic' disease is being muted re some cancers now. I also find myself smiling and appreciating alot more these days. Jo
Posts.Title: How many do you know?

Posts.Content: Hi JJ... So pleased your'e home now, what a time youve had. Youre definitely right about complications arising that we dont give a second thought to before hand. Sounds like you had some thing similar to me...PVL Staph Aureus...caused fascitis to my wounds, broke them down in hours... as you know which 21 weeks later are just starting to heal now...causing hole in my chest and complete infra-mammmory fold breakdown...it sure does suck. Even though i work in healthcare i was aware of MRSA and MSSA but not that.....only affects 2% of SA infections, nasty blighter. Hope your recovery continues to progress and you can start to get over this debilitating period soon. Bet its good to be out and get some quality rest, take care and take it easy. Jo.x
Posts.Title: Back from hospital after DIEP

Posts.Content: Go girl...good luck Kath99.
Posts.Title: great north run

Posts.Content: I do really feel for you...VacPac is so hard to tolerate, not just physically but it does work well. I dont mind you askng at all love.  I had therapeutic mammoplasty after nro adjuvant chemo for stage 2 IDC& DCIS....clear margins and nodes so all good. Wound broke down and became necrotic along suture margin. Then had 2 debridements under GA  and 3 debridements in clinic ...had vac pac on for 3 weeks but had allergic reaction to adhesive dressing...hydrofilm used to secure it. Skin was a right mess but plastics worked wonders and 4th/  last op was Advanced Flap to  close the wound on 10th Dec. Still issues and had further revision & suturing to wound today after it dehisced slightly & Still need further procedure next week to hopefully fully close problem areas i still have. Sounds meh but believe me after all the assaults its had my boob looks surprisingly ok...scarred yes but i am so grateful for the skills of my surgeons. Hang in there, it may not seem like it at times but you will heal....be kind to yourself and take it easy. Be thinking about you, best wishes Jo
Posts.Title: How soon after surgery should hormone therapy start?

Posts.Content: Hey...i started my hormone therapy 2 weeks after initial surgery in Oct 15 but was stopped due to wound issues like youve had...vacpac, need for further surgery - due to thrombosis risk with it....once they were confident that no more surgery was needed it was restarted. I also awt RXT...but alas now been told i probably need further surgery in a few weeks so it'll be stopped again! Hope you get some answers from your onco team.x
Posts.Title: How soon after surgery should hormone therapy start?

Posts.Content: "Ow, my eye, my eye"....:0)... thanks George.
Posts.Title: Twitches

Posts.Content: Just to say hope all goes well JJ, thinking of you tomorrow. Jo.
Posts.Title: Bilateral mastectomy and recon on Thursday sacred!!!!

Posts.Content: Has anyone else experiences any twitches around eyes after Docetaxel??....the day after having 3rd dose woke up and around my right eye was twitching...no other way to describe it. Around my eyelid and eyebrow...not painful, just like an exagerated muscle tick you get when tired sometimes. Now im day 12 post dose  and both my eyebrows are doing a mexican hat dance...all the time, its driving me nuts!! A bit of a strange question i know......
Posts.Title: Twitches
